item.title: Trump Heralds Economic Policies in Combative State of the Union Speech
item.description: President Trump portrayed the United States as safe and “winning” in his State of the Union address. He also derided Democrats, repeating baseless claims that they cheat in elections and assailing them on immigration.
item.dc:creator: Meg Felling

item.title: ‘Stand Up’: With One Maneuver, Trump Tries to Box In Democrats
item.description: President Trump turned his State of the Union address into full-blown political theater, handing out medals to war veterans and tossing the spotlight to ice hockey players.
item.dc:creator: Shawn McCreesh

item.title: Word of the Day: virtuosity
item.description: This word has appeared in 80 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel Goes Live After a Super Long State of the Union
item.description: “I can’t believe America missed an all-new ‘Will Trent’ for this one,” he joked.
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)
Late Night with Seth Meyers (TV Program)

item.title: Rubio Was Looking at His Phone After Trump Praised Him in State of the Union Speech
item.description: Shortly after Secretary of State Marco Rubio was singled out for praise, a New York Times photographer captured him reading messages from Mr. Trump’s special envoy to Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Julian E. Barnes

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio reading messages on his phone during President Trump’s speech on Tuesday.

item.title: 6 Takeaways From Trump’s State of the Union
item.description: In an address that was heavy on theatrics, President Trump lashed out at Democrats as “crazy” and unpatriotic.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Pager and Luke Broadwater
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: President Donald J. Trump delivers the first State of the Union address of his second term on Tuesday night.

item.title: Democratic Response to Trump’s State of the Union
item.description: Gov. Abigail Spanberger of Virginia delivered the Democratic response to President Trump’s State of the Union address.
item.dc:creator: Jiawei Wang

media:content.media:description: Gov. Abigail Spanberger of Virginia delivered a Democratic rebuttal to President Trump that struck the political notes her party’s leaders are aiming to press on the economy and other issues.

item.title: La prohibición del maquillaje en Siria provoca vergüenza y burlas
item.description: Un gobernador provincial quiere prohibir que las mujeres que trabajan en el gobierno y el sector público usen maquillaje, lo que ha provocado indignación y una avalancha de memes.
item.dc:creator: Raja Abdulrahim

media:content.media:credit: Diego Ibarra Sanchez para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Mujeres pasando el tiempo en un café en Latakia, Siria, en mayo.

item.title: No, the Dollar Is Not Dying
item.description: The currency is stumbling, by many accounts. But the narrative is false.
item.dc:creator: Eswar Prasad

item.title: The World Waited on Edge for Trump’s Thinking on Iran. It’s Still Waiting.
item.description: Even as the president considers an attack, his State of the Union address offered little more than a brief repetition of vague talking points from recent days.
item.dc:creator: Anton Troianovski
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: Gen. Dan Caine, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, left, and other military leaders listening to President Trump deliver his State of the Union address in the Capitol on Tuesday.

item.title: Leader of Columbia Brain Institute Quits Over Friendship With Epstein
item.description: The Nobel laureate Richard Axel is not accused of wrongdoing but called his association with Jeffrey Epstein a “serious error in judgment.”
item.dc:creator: Sharon Otterman

media:content.media:description: Dr. Richard Axel was a co-director of the Mortimer B. Zuckerman Mind Brain Behavior Institute at Columbia University,

item.title: Abigail Spanberger, in Democratic Response, Asks if Trump Is Working for Americans
item.description: “We all know the answer is no,” the Virginia governor argued in her rebuttal to President Trump’s State of the Union address.
item.dc:creator: Reid J. Epstein

item.title: In Address, Trump Calls for More Limits on Trans Youth
item.description: During the State of the Union address, the president said states “must ban” social transitions among young people without parental consent.
item.dc:creator: Amy Harmon

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Sage Blair, middle, was recognized by President Trump during his State of the Union address on Tuesday.

item.title: Trump’s State of the Union Speech: Full Transcript
item.description: President Trump spoke for nearly two hours to a joint session of Congress.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Demetrius Freeman for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump’s speech was broadcast live on a television in a cafeteria at the Capitol on Tuesday night.

item.title: Los chips de Taiwán y la amenaza de un ‘apocalipsis económico’
item.description: Si China invade Taiwán e interrumpe sus exportaciones de chips a las empresas estadounidenses, la industria tecnológica de Estados Unidos, y la economía mundial, quedarían paralizadas.
item.dc:creator: Tripp Mickle

media:content.media:credit: Ilustración fotográfica por Ben Jones; fuente de las fotografías para la ilustración Lam Yik Fei para The New York Times; Loren Elliott para The New York Times; Chang W. Lee/The New York Times

item.title: Democrats, Boycotting Trump’s Speech, Rally Outside the Capitol
item.description: Dozens of House and Senate members skipped the speech and, in a counter event on the National Mall, criticized the president’s policies on immigration, health care and the economy.
item.dc:creator: Megan Mineiro

media:content.media:credit: Caroline Gutman for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The People’s State of the Union on the National Mall in Washington on Tuesday night.

item.title: Fact-Checking Trump’s State of the Union Speech
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

item.title: In Windsor, Some See Family Drama in the Andrew Accusations
item.description: “Her children have let her down,” said one woman, referring to Queen Elizabeth II. Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor’s fall from grace drew strong reactions from some. Others said they just did not care.
item.dc:creator: Megan Specia and Stephen Castle
item.category: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom
Elizabeth II, Queen of Great Britain

media:content.media:description: Queen Elizabeth II and members of the royal family at Buckingham Palace, in 2019.

item.title: Rusia ha arriesgado su estabilidad económica por la guerra
item.description: La obstinación del presidente Putin con la guerra en Ucrania ha reordenado la economía y la sociedad rusas de un modo que podría poner en peligro el futuro de la nación.
item.dc:creator: Paul Sonne

media:content.media:credit: Nanna Heitmann para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Un cartel de reclutamiento del ejército ruso en Moscú, en junio. La guerra en Ucrania ha matado o herido a 1,2 millones de rusos.

item.title: Trump Gives Out Awards, Including Presidential Medal of Freedom, at State of the Union
item.description: The president announced medals for the U.S. men’s hockey team’s star goalie as well as several military veterans.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Ahn

media:content.media:description: Members of the U.S. men’s hockey team in the House chamber at the Capitol on Tuesday night.

item.title: Corrections: Feb. 25, 2026
item.description: Corrections that appeared in print on Wednesday, Feb. 25, 2026.

item.title: Futsal Phenom in Afghanistan Is a Hero the Taliban Didn’t Expect
item.description: A triumph in indoor soccer has turned Alireza Ahmadi, 17, and other players from the Hazara minority, long marginalized in Afghanistan, into national heroes.
item.dc:creator: Elian Peltier, Yaqoob Akbary and Tomás Munita

media:content.media:credit: Tomás Munita for The New York Times

item.title: Abu Dhabi’s State Oil Company Looks Beyond Oil
item.description: Having reshaped the company, Sultan Ahmed Al Jaber wants to expand internationally, particularly in natural gas, chemicals and renewables.
item.dc:creator: Stanley Reed and Natalie Naccache

media:content.media:description: Sultan Ahmed Al Jaber has helped put ADNOC, Abu Dhabi’s state oil company, on the map as a global deal maker.

item.title: Quote of the Day: Reliance on Taiwan Chips Endangers U.S. Economy
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, February 25, 2026.

item.title: Why Democratic Congresswomen Wore White to Trump’s State of the Union Again
item.description: It’s not the first time some Democratic women have displayed unity by wearing the same color, but this time it was in part to signal opposition to the SAVE America Act.
item.dc:creator: Jesse McKinley

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Some Democratic congresswomen donned the same color for the president’s State of the Union address, while dozens of other Democrats boycotted the event.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Feb. 25, 2026
item.description: Brad Lively makes our heads spin.
item.dc:creator: Sam Corbin

item.title: State of the Union Live Updates: Trump Heralds Economic and Border Policies While Deriding Democrats
item.description: The president projected a version of the United States that is growing, safe and “winning.” In the Democratic response, Gov. Abigail Spanberger of Virginia accused the president of sowing fear and lying about the economy.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times
